title: Plate, "Dancers", ca. 1927
markings: Marks: On underside: 3443 incised in clay
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Large, circular, with scene of three figures--man playing accordion, man and woman dancing--in pastoral setting. Glazes predominantly green, red, yellow, separated by cloisonne-like ridges

tombstone.epitaph:
Plate, "Dancers", ca. 1927.
ca. 1927. earthenware, glaze. The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1989-41-28.
